WRITING.TITLE: What are your top Jonny Wilkinson moments?
WRITING.TEXT:
As there is a lull now before the next Six Nations overload. I thought I would attempt to do the great legend justice.
These moments could range from tries, tackles and moments of great skill. Additionally I would like to include historic moments in his career. Feel free to post them here.

WRITING.TITLE: Linebreak Rugby are back with another Podcast. (Appears to be slight audio issues but still a good listen)

WRITING.TEXT: A very interesting and in depth read mate. Loved the podcast as always.

The club that I play for has gone up two leagues in two seasons and we are getting to the stage where we are playing teams where there a lot of contracted players. We have now got to the stage where we need to keep our very best players but we do not want to lose our roots of being an amateur side that has a strong base of local players. It appears that we have managed to get around this in 3 ways.
1. Focus strongly on the youth side of the team. Players that have been with the club for years are more likely to come back to us and stay loyal to the club.
2. Local companies such as bricklayers and pubs sponsor individual players and pay for their kit etc. In turn there sponsor is next to the player in the match day programme. I imagine it helps the sponsor to be seen as supporting the local team.
3. They have now offered to pay for petrol for players to make training if they live more than 10 miles away. Additionally we get three free pints after the game if we have been constantly at training which is always an incentive!
Beautiful.

I would not be too disheartened my friend. I have read many articles stating how Japanese rugby is on the up and setting up key foundations to grow the sport. I see that the Sunwolves, despite regularly losing games are filling out there stadiums. I think sport has always had one ultimate trait. And that is that if there is there a big enough audience for a sport in a certain country, then money will be spent on that sport. Japan will be pouring a lot of money into rugby over the next decade or so and you can bet that it will pay dividends to the Japanese national teams sporting success in some way or other over the next few years.
TL;DR: Japan will be fine.

I completely agree on this one. As an England fan, I fear Ireland are going to bring a stellar performance to Dublin in 3 weeks time and that we might suffer another 15+ point loss in a Grand Slam decider.
That's a fair judgement mate.

WRITING.TITLE: BBC copyright strike query.
WRITING.TEXT:
Hey guys, I have recently received two copyright strikes from RBS Six Nations about using footage from the rugby tournament. However other user have posted footage in the past from the same provider and not received any sanctions. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4ul5x2Kuk9M .
Do any of you know a way that I can avoid these strikes in the future or any tips to get around them. Thanks a lot.
Yeah good idea mate thanks a lot.

WRITING.TEXT: Does anybody know how I will be able to upload a Six Nations edit without them taking my channel down. I love making videos and don't want to lose my channel.

WRITING.TITLE: R/RugbyUnion Appreciation post.
WRITING.TEXT:
Just thought I would post a little post to show how grateful I am that there is a community here that is so great. I have never seen such scales of interaction like there is in this sub. I feel like there are regulars here and that really is a great thing. People don't downvote other posts because they don't agree with it, they instead put in a comment to spark debate. I came to this sub 9 months ago posting a small montage that was my first ever made and the amount of advise I was given was astounding. You don't get that in other communities. Additionally, I see a lot of other sites actually going to this sub to grab interesting information and this shows just how much activity and diversity there is here. Won't be long until we hit 50k readers and long may this community thrive!
TL;DR: I love the community and the top lads.
Ever feeling shit drop me a message.
Make sure to try and take progress photos every month. Really helps to make you realise just how much gains you make in the first year even if you might not notice them.
That's life mate, just focus on that self improvement.
Beautiful weekend in Cardiff.
That's a plan I can get behind.
Can I steal? Xoxo

WRITING.TITLE: Scotland team to Face Wales

WRITING.TEXT: I think if Italy won it would be the biggest upset in rugby history of ALL time.

Yeah my choices probably aren't the same as many of the other choices that would be out there. I just can't see Scotland beating Wales now with North back in the fold and I do believe they played very well 2 weeks ago. I still think France could win the tournament with my conspiracy theory that they always win on the 7th year of every decade. And yeah Italy well, will be Italy.

I had to look deep into myself and put for company...
*YouTube?*

[This is the kind of thing they send you](http://i.imgur.com/yoVcjrK.png). It is purely designed for media agencies so there are no commercial emails that get sent your way. They give information and times about press conferences and basic information about big news such as Greg Laidlaw's injury today.

WRITING.TITLE: To receive Six Nations information before everyone else then sign up to Six Nations Press Office. They email news to you and this is where News Pages get their information.

When people see these kinds of videos, half the people will instantly zone out (myself included). There must be thousands if not hundreds of thousands of these videos on youtube with boys girls, men and women in their rooms recording music. Granted she has an amazing voice but maybe she would be better off making the visuals something unique and creative. Maybe having the camera placed inside the guitar showing the strings or something. In such a saturated place for this kind of video she sadly needs more than talent to stand out!

WRITING.TITLE: My love for Launchbury
WRITING.TEXT: So many great things I can say about this guy. Last year he kept working at it while Itoje and Kruis were getting all the plaudits and he came back all the stronger. He seems to be so humble as well. At the final whistle he kept a cool head and his workrate is unbelievable. Heard a lot of murmurs that Itoje is a future England captain but I think Joe could be in with a shout in 2-3 years.

My two pence on the game. It was utterly enthralling and the atmosphere was sublime. The tackles in the game were ferocious and Wales pushed us so hard that at points I simply couldn't watch the game. The crowd through the stadium and Cardiff were amazing. It's a mixture of pride and intimidation which must be so intimidating for visiting teams. A great game which I will remember for a long time.
